questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris has been the capital of France since 987 AD.

questions.question: What is the capital of Japan?
questions.explanation: Tokyo is the capital and most populous city of Japan.

questions.question: What is the capital of the United States?
questions.explanation: Washington D.C. has been the capital since 1800.

questions.question: What is the capital of Germany?
questions.explanation: Berlin has been the capital of unified Germany since 1990.

questions.question: What is the capital of Italy?
questions.explanation: Rome, the Eternal City, has been the capital since 1871.

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the purpose-built capital, chosen as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.question: What is the capital of Canada?
questions.explanation: Ottawa became the capital in 1857, chosen by Queen Victoria.

questions.question: What is the capital of Brazil?
questions.explanation: Brasília was purpose-built and became the capital in 1960.

questions.question: What is the capital of Kazakhstan?
questions.explanation: Astana (formerly Nur-Sultan) became the capital in 1997, replacing Almaty.

questions.question: What is the capital of Myanmar?
questions.explanation: Naypyidaw became the capital in 2006, replacing Yangon.

questions.question: What is the capital of Spain?
questions.explanation: Madrid is both the capital and the largest city of Spain.

questions.question: What is the capital of Russia?
questions.explanation: Moscow is the capital and largest city of Russia.

questions.question: What is the capital of China?
questions.explanation: Beijing has been the capital of China for most of the past 800 years.

questions.question: What is the capital of India?
questions.explanation: New Delhi is the capital of India, established in 1931.

questions.question: What is the capital of Egypt?
questions.explanation: Cairo, one of the world's oldest cities, is the capital of Egypt.

questions.question: What is the capital of Turkey?
questions.explanation: Ankara became the capital in 1923, replacing Istanbul.

questions.question: What is the capital of the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: London has been England's capital since the 11th century.

questions.question: What is the capital of Switzerland?
questions.explanation: Bern has been the de facto capital since 1848.

questions.question: What is the capital of Poland?
questions.explanation: Warsaw has been the capital since 1596.

questions.question: What is the capital of Greece?
questions.explanation: Athens is the historic capital of Greece, named after the goddess Athena.

questions.question: New York is the capital of the United States.
questions.explanation: Washington D.C. is the capital, not New York.

questions.question: Dublin is the capital of Ireland.
questions.explanation: Dublin has been the capital of Ireland since medieval times.

questions.question: Sydney is the capital of Australia.
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital, not Sydney.

questions.question: Pretoria is one of the capitals of South Africa.
questions.explanation: South Africa has three capitals: Pretoria (executive), Cape Town (legislative), and Bloemfontein (judicial).

questions.question: What is the capital of Argentina?
questions.explanation: Buenos Aires is the capital and largest city of Argentina.

questions.question: Which city is known as the Big Apple?
questions.explanation: New York City earned the nickname 'Big Apple' in the 1920s.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Eiffel Tower?
questions.explanation: The Eiffel Tower was built in Paris for the 1889 World's Fair.

questions.question: Which city was formerly known as Constantinople?
questions.explanation: Constantinople was renamed Istanbul in 1930.

questions.question: Which city is built on 14 islands?
questions.explanation: Stockholm, the capital of Sweden, is built on 14 islands.

questions.question: What is the highest mountain in the world?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest stands at 8,849 meters (29,032 feet).

questions.question: In which mountain range is Mount Everest located?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest is part of the Himalayan mountain range.

questions.question: What is the highest mountain in Africa?
questions.explanation: Mount Kilimanjaro in Tanzania stands at 5,895 meters.

questions.question: Which is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River is approximately 6,650 km long.

questions.question: Which river flows through Paris?
questions.explanation: The Seine River divides Paris into the Left and Right Banks.

questions.question: Which river flows through London?
questions.explanation: The River Thames is London's iconic waterway.

questions.question: Which desert is the largest in the world?
questions.explanation: The Antarctic Desert is technically the world's largest desert.

questions.question: What is the largest hot desert in the world?
questions.explanation: The Sahara Desert covers about 9 million square kilometers.

questions.question: Which country has the most time zones?
questions.explanation: France has 12 time zones due to its overseas territories.

questions.question: Which country is the smallest in the world?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is only 0.44 square kilometers.

questions.question: Which country has the longest coastline?
questions.explanation: Canada has over 202,080 km of coastline.

questions.question: What is the capital of Portugal?
questions.explanation: Lisbon has been the capital since 1255.

questions.question: What is the capital of Norway?
questions.explanation: Oslo became the capital in 1814.

questions.question: What is the capital of Sweden?
questions.explanation: Stockholm has been the capital since 1436.

questions.question: What is the capital of Finland?
questions.explanation: Helsinki became the capital in 1812.

questions.question: What is the capital of Denmark?
questions.explanation: Copenhagen has been the capital since the 15th century.

questions.question: What is the capital of Iceland?
questions.explanation: Reykjavik is the northernmost capital of a sovereign state.

questions.question: What is the capital of Austria?
questions.explanation: Vienna has been the capital for over 600 years.

questions.question: What is the capital of Czech Republic?
questions.explanation: Prague has been the capital since the 9th century.

questions.question: What is the capital of Hungary?
questions.explanation: Budapest was formed in 1873 from the merger of Buda and Pest.

questions.question: What is the capital of Romania?
questions.explanation: Bucharest became the capital in 1862.

questions.question: What is the capital of Bulgaria?
questions.explanation: Sofia has been the capital since 1879.

questions.question: What is the capital of Slovakia?
questions.explanation: Bratislava became the capital in 1993 when Slovakia became independent.

questions.question: What is the capital of Slovenia?
questions.explanation: Ljubljana became the capital when Slovenia gained independence in 1991.

questions.question: What is the capital of Croatia?
questions.explanation: Zagreb has been the capital since 1557.

questions.question: What is the capital of the Netherlands?
questions.explanation: Amsterdam is the constitutional capital, though the government is in The Hague.

questions.question: What is the capital of Belgium?
questions.explanation: Brussels is also the de facto capital of the European Union.

questions.question: What is the capital of Luxembourg?
questions.explanation: Luxembourg City is one of the EU's three capitals.

questions.question: What is the capital of Mexico?
questions.explanation: Mexico City has been the capital since Aztec times.

questions.question: What is the capital of Chile?
questions.explanation: Santiago has been the capital since 1541.

questions.question: What is the capital of Peru?
questions.explanation: Lima was founded in 1535 and has been the capital ever since.

questions.question: What is the capital of Colombia?
questions.explanation: Bogotá has been the capital since 1538.

questions.question: What is the capital of Venezuela?
questions.explanation: Caracas became the capital in 1577.

questions.question: What is the capital of Ecuador?
questions.explanation: Quito is one of the highest capitals in the world at 2,850m.

questions.question: What is the capital of Bolivia?
questions.explanation: Sucre is the constitutional capital, La Paz is the seat of government.

questions.question: What is the capital of Paraguay?
questions.explanation: Asunción is one of the oldest cities in South America.

questions.question: What is the capital of Uruguay?
questions.explanation: Montevideo has been the capital since 1828.

questions.question: What is the capital of South Korea?
questions.explanation: Seoul has been the capital for over 600 years.

questions.question: What is the capital of Thailand?
questions.explanation: Bangkok's full ceremonial name is the longest city name in the world.

questions.question: What is the capital of Vietnam?
questions.explanation: Hanoi has been the capital since 1976 (unified Vietnam).

questions.question: What is the capital of Malaysia?
questions.explanation: Kuala Lumpur has been the capital since 1880.

questions.question: What is the capital of Indonesia?
questions.explanation: Jakarta is being replaced by Nusantara as the capital in the 2020s.

questions.question: What is the capital of Philippines?
questions.explanation: Manila is the capital, though Metro Manila includes multiple cities.

questions.question: What is the capital of Singapore?
questions.explanation: Singapore is a city-state, so the city and country share the same name.

questions.question: What is the capital of New Zealand?
questions.explanation: Wellington has been the capital since 1865.

questions.question: What is the capital of South Africa?
options: All three: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein
questions.correctAnswer: All three: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein
questions.explanation: South Africa uniquely has three capitals for different government branches.

questions.question: What is the capital of Kenya?
questions.explanation: Nairobi became the capital in 1907.

questions.question: What is the capital of Nigeria?
questions.explanation: Abuja became the capital in 1991, replacing Lagos.

questions.question: What is the capital of Ethiopia?
questions.explanation: Addis Ababa is also the headquarters of the African Union.

questions.question: What is the capital of Morocco?
questions.explanation: Rabat has been the capital since 1912.

questions.question: What is the capital of Algeria?
questions.explanation: Algiers has been the capital since the 10th century.

questions.question: What is the capital of Tunisia?
questions.explanation: Tunis has been the capital since 1159.

questions.question: What is the capital of Libya?
questions.explanation: Tripoli has been the capital since 1951.

questions.question: What is the capital of Saudi Arabia?
questions.explanation: Riyadh has been the capital since 1824.

questions.question: What is the capital of United Arab Emirates?
questions.explanation: Abu Dhabi is the capital and the largest emirate.

questions.question: What is the capital of Israel?
questions.explanation: Jerusalem has been declared as Israel's capital, though it's disputed internationally.

questions.question: What is the capital of Iran?
questions.explanation: Tehran has been the capital since 1786.

questions.question: What is the capital of Iraq?
questions.explanation: Baghdad has been a major city since 762 AD.

questions.question: What is the capital of Jordan?
questions.explanation: Amman has been the capital since 1921.

questions.question: What is the capital of Lebanon?
questions.explanation: Beirut has been inhabited for over 5,000 years.

questions.question: What is the capital of Pakistan?
questions.explanation: Islamabad was purpose-built and became the capital in 1967.

questions.question: What is the capital of Afghanistan?
questions.explanation: Kabul has been the capital for over 200 years.

questions.question: What is the capital of Bangladesh?
questions.explanation: Dhaka is one of the world's most densely populated cities.

questions.question: What is the capital of Sri Lanka?
questions.explanation: Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte is the legislative capital, while Colombo is the commercial capital.

questions.question: What is the capital of Nepal?
questions.explanation: Kathmandu is located in a valley surrounded by the Himalayas.

questions.question: What is the capital of Mongolia?
questions.explanation: Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital city in the world.

questions.question: Which city is known as the City of Love?
questions.explanation: Paris is famously known as the City of Love and the City of Light.

questions.question: Which city is built on seven hills?
questions.explanation: Rome is famously built on seven hills: Aventine, Caelian, Capitoline, Esquiline, Palatine, Quirinal, and Viminal.

questions.question: Which city is known as the Eternal City?
questions.explanation: Rome has been called the Eternal City for over 2,000 years.

questions.question: Which city is famous for its canals and gondolas?
questions.explanation: Venice is built on 118 small islands connected by canals.

questions.question: Which city was formerly called Byzantium?
questions.explanation: Istanbul was called Byzantium, then Constantinople, before its current name.

questions.question: What is the capital of Uzbekistan?
questions.explanation: Tashkent became the capital in 1930.

questions.question: What is the capital of Azerbaijan?
questions.explanation: Baku is located on the Caspian Sea coast.

questions.question: What is the capital of Armenia?
questions.explanation: Yerevan is one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities.

questions.question: What is the capital of Georgia?
questions.explanation: Tbilisi has been the capital since the 5th century.

questions.question: What is the capital of Ukraine?
questions.explanation: Kyiv is one of the oldest cities in Eastern Europe.

questions.question: What is the capital of Belarus?
questions.explanation: Minsk became the capital in 1919.

questions.question: What is the capital of Moldova?
questions.explanation: Chișinău has been the capital since 1812.

questions.question: What is the capital of Serbia?
questions.explanation: Belgrade is one of the oldest cities in Europe.

questions.question: What is the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina?
questions.explanation: Sarajevo is known for its diverse religious heritage.

questions.question: What is the capital of Montenegro?
questions.explanation: Podgorica became the capital in 1946.

questions.question: What is the capital of North Macedonia?
questions.explanation: Skopje has been the capital since 1991 independence.

questions.question: What is the capital of Albania?
questions.explanation: Tirana became the capital in 1920.

questions.question: What is the capital of Kosovo?
questions.explanation: Pristina has been the capital since 2008.

questions.question: What is the capital of Estonia?
questions.explanation: Tallinn is one of the best-preserved medieval cities in Europe.

questions.question: What is the capital of Latvia?
questions.explanation: Riga is the largest city in the Baltic states.

questions.question: What is the capital of Lithuania?
questions.explanation: Vilnius is known for its baroque architecture.

questions.question: What is the capital of Ireland?
questions.explanation: Dublin is located on the east coast at the mouth of the River Liffey.

questions.question: What is the capital of Cuba?
questions.explanation: Havana is the largest city in the Caribbean.

questions.question: What is the capital of Jamaica?
questions.explanation: Kingston is the largest English-speaking city in the Caribbean.

questions.question: What is the capital of Haiti?
questions.explanation: Port-au-Prince was founded in 1749.

questions.question: What is the capital of Dominican Republic?
questions.explanation: Santo Domingo is the oldest continuously inhabited European settlement in the Americas.

questions.question: What is the capital of Costa Rica?
questions.explanation: San José became the capital in 1823.

questions.question: What is the capital of Panama?
questions.explanation: Panama City was founded in 1519.

questions.question: What is the capital of Nicaragua?
questions.explanation: Managua became the capital in 1852.

questions.question: What is the capital of Honduras?
questions.explanation: Tegucigalpa has been the capital since 1880.

questions.question: What is the capital of El Salvador?
questions.explanation: San Salvador was founded in 1525.

questions.question: What is the capital of Guatemala?
questions.explanation: Guatemala City was founded in 1776.

questions.question: What is the capital of Belize?
questions.explanation: Belmopan became the capital in 1970 after Hurricane Hattie.

questions.question: What is the capital of Qatar?
questions.explanation: Doha is located on the coast of the Persian Gulf.

questions.question: What is the capital of Kuwait?
questions.explanation: Kuwait City has been the capital since 1613.

questions.question: What mountain range separates Europe from Asia?
questions.explanation: The Ural Mountains form the natural boundary between Europe and Asia.

questions.question: What is the highest mountain in North America?
questions.explanation: Denali (formerly Mount McKinley) is 6,190m tall.

questions.question: What is the highest mountain in the Alps?
questions.explanation: Mont Blanc stands at 4,808 meters.

questions.question: What is the second highest mountain in the world?
questions.explanation: K2 is 8,611 meters tall, second only to Everest.

questions.question: Which river is the longest in Europe?
questions.explanation: The Volga River is 3,530 km long.

questions.question: Which river flows through Rome?
questions.explanation: The Tiber River has been central to Rome's history.

questions.question: Which river flows through Cairo?
questions.explanation: The Nile flows through Egypt's capital.

questions.question: Which river forms the border between USA and Mexico?
questions.explanation: The Rio Grande is about 3,000 km long.

questions.question: Which is the largest river by discharge volume?
questions.explanation: The Amazon discharges more water than the next seven largest rivers combined.

questions.question: What is the largest island in the world?
questions.explanation: Greenland is 2.17 million km².

questions.question: Australia is both a country and a continent.
questions.explanation: Australia is the world's smallest continent and the sixth-largest country.

questions.question: The Dead Sea is the lowest point on Earth's surface.
questions.explanation: The Dead Sea is about 430 meters below sea level.

questions.question: The Pacific Ocean is larger than all continents combined.
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean covers about 165 million km².

questions.question: Mount Everest is still growing taller each year.
questions.explanation: Everest grows about 4mm per year due to tectonic activity.

questions.question: Russia spans 11 time zones.
questions.explanation: Russia is the largest country by area.

questions.question: Africa is the second-largest continent.
questions.explanation: Africa is 30.37 million km².

questions.question: Iceland has more volcanoes than any other country.
questions.explanation: Indonesia has the most volcanoes.

questions.question: The Sahara is a hot desert.
questions.explanation: The Sahara is the world's largest hot desert.

questions.question: The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of Earth's oxygen.
questions.explanation: This is a myth; oceans produce most oxygen.

questions.question: Lake Baikal in Russia is the world's deepest lake.
questions.explanation: Lake Baikal is 1,642 meters deep.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Statue of Liberty?
questions.explanation: The Statue of Liberty is on Liberty Island in New York Harbor.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Colosseum?
questions.explanation: The Colosseum was built between 70-80 AD.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Burj Khalifa?
questions.explanation: The Burj Khalifa is the world's tallest building at 828m.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Christ the Redeemer statue?
questions.explanation: Christ the Redeemer overlooks Rio from Corcovado mountain.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Taj Mahal?
questions.explanation: The Taj Mahal was built in 1632-1653.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Sagrada Família?
questions.explanation: The Sagrada Família has been under construction since 1882.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Petronas Towers?
questions.explanation: The Petronas Towers were the tallest buildings from 1998-2004.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Hagia Sophia?
questions.explanation: The Hagia Sophia was built in 537 AD.

questions.question: Which city is home to Big Ben?
questions.explanation: Big Ben is the nickname for the Great Bell of the Palace of Westminster.

questions.question: Which city is home to the Sydney Opera House?
questions.explanation: The Sydney Opera House was completed in 1973.
